intro: Leachia trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaf leachia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Leachia trifoliata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
